message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
        Scanner input = new Scanner(new File(" "));
        String codeString = input.next();
        input.close();
        
        PrintWriter work = new PrintWriter("EncryptedDocument.txt");
        work.print(codeString + " ");
        work.close();
    } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The error "unreported exception java.io.FileNotFoundException; must be caught or declared to be thrown" is occurring because you are using the Scanner and PrintWriter classes, which can throw a FileNotFoundException. To fix this, you need to either catch the exception using a try-catch block or declare that the main method throws the exception. In the provided code, I have added a try-catch block to catch the FileNotFoundException and print the stack trace.
